Your voice will carry the weight of the story, from quiet tension to moments that crack with emotion. Weâ€™re looking for tone, timing, and authenticity.

items.title: Altarena Playhouse (Alameda, CA) is holding auditions for the musical ***ANYTHINâ€¦
items.summary:
Altarena Playhouse (Alameda, CA) is holding auditions for the musical ***ANYTHING GOES*****.**

 

Music & lyrics by Cole Porter

Original book by Guy Bolton, P.G. Wodehouse, Howard Lindsay, and Russel Crouse; revised by Timothy Crouse and John Weidman

Directed by Laura Morgan

Musical direction by Armando Fox

Choreography by Rachelle King Campodonico

March 27 â€“ April 26, 2026

 

Cole Porterâ€™s *Anything Goes* is a timeless classic filled with toe-tapping melodies, witty lyrics, and spirited characters. Set aboard a transatlantic ocean liner, the musical follows an unpredictable voyage of love triangles and mistaken identities. With timeless standards like â€œYouâ€™re the Top,â€ â€œI Get a Kick Out of You,â€ and the title song, *Anything Goes* blends romance, comedy, and show-stopping dance.

 

Auditions (by appointment):

Sunday, November 2, 6-9pm

Monday, November 3, 7-10pm

 

Callbacks (by invitation only):

Saturday, November 8, 10am-3pm.  You may or may not be called for the whole time.

 

Rehearsals begin approximately January 25. Performances are Friday and Saturday nights and Sunday matinees.   Please bring a complete list of conflicts to the audition.  No conflicts accepted during tech week.

 

**Please prepare **a 16-32 bar selection of an uptempo song in the style of the show (but preferably not from the show). Bring sheet music in the correct key; accompanist will be provided. Please bring a headshot, rÃ©sumÃ©, and audition form provided on the SignUp.

 

There will be a mandatory tap call at auditions for anyone auditioning for Reno or the Angels.  However, tap skills will be a plus for anyone auditioning, so if you have tap experience or even think you can fake it in jazz shoes, weâ€™d love to see you at the tap call as well.  There will be at least two of the tap calls each audition night, so you should attend the one closest to your audition time.  There will be a separate movement call at callbacks for the non-tappers.    

 

Please contact Katina at artisticdirector@altarena.org should you have any questions.

 

Performers of all races, ethnicities, and genders are encouraged to audition. Non-AEA only.  These are volunteer positions, but there is a $500 expense reimbursement available for the run.

 

Visit SignUp Genius for sides, character descriptions, more information, and to make an appointment

[https://www.signupgenius.com/go/9040F4FAFAB28A2F94-58527177-anything](https://www.signupgenius.com/go/9040F4FAFAB28A2F94-58527177-anything)

** **

ROLES:

**Note**: Some roles may also understudy principals. In some cases, understudies may be scheduled for a guaranteed performance. Understudies will receive rehearsal time to ensure they are prepared to step into the role(s).

 

**Reno Sweeney **- (30s-40s) A charismatic nightclub singer and former evangelist. She is clever, funny, persuasive, and extremely confident. Strong singing and dancing required as well as comedic timing. Alto belter - G3-Eb5

**Billy Crocker** - (20s-30s) A young Wall Street broker in love with Hope.  He stows away on the ship and goes to great lengths to prevent Hopeâ€™s marriage to Lord Evelyn.  Tenor - B2-G4

**Hope Harcourt** - (20s) A young American debutante.  A dutiful daughter who is willing to marry to please her mother, despite her growing attraction to Billy.  Legit mezzo - G3-Eb5

**Moonface Martin** - (30s-50s) A somewhat failed gangster who is nowhere near as menacing as he thinks he is.  Speaks with a New York character accent. Ranked as Public Enemy #13, he longs to move up the list. Bari-tenor - Bb2-Gb4

**Bonnie** - (20s-30s) A typical gangsterâ€™s moll with a New York character accent.  Not too sad when her boyfriend misses the boat and she has her pick of sailors.  Alto - Eb4-E5

**Evelyn Oakleigh** - (30s-40s) A slightly awkward but endearing British lord with a mania for American slang.  Baritone - C2-E4

**Mrs. Harcourt **- (40s-50s) Hopeâ€™s overbearing mother concerned primarily with social standing and money. Any vocal range.

**Elisha J. Whitney/Bishop Dobson** - (40s-60s) Whitney is a successful Ivy League Wall Street banker/business tycoon, nearsighted, and a gloriously functional drunk with a huge personality. Used to snapping his fingers and having the world stop to listen.  The Bishop is a solemn and serious man of the cloth mistaken for a gangster.  Any vocal range.

**Angels** - Backup dancers and singers in Renoâ€™s nightclub act.  Excellent tap and dance skills required.  Various ages and vocal ranges.

**Captain/Reporter/**possibly other character roles - (Open to any age) Bari-tenor or tenor

**Convert #1 and #2** - (Open to any age) New York hooligans allegedly reformed by Bishop Dobson, but they slip back easily into their old ways.  May be played by any gender and will be double-tracked with other parts.

items.title:
**Casting Call Looking To Cast Roles For Batman Fan Film.**

Hi my name is Lucasâ€¦
items.summary:
**Casting Call Looking To Cast Roles For Batman Fan Film.**

Hi my name is Lucas Woolrich. I'm working on a Batman fan film titled Batman Gotham City Sirens. The film will be uploaded onto Youtube. The story for the film would see Batman/Bruce Wayne teaming up with Robin/Carrie Kelley to face off against Harley Quinn, Catwoman, Poison Ivy and Deathstroke.

Here is the list of characters I am looking to cast for the film.

**DEATHSTROKE**

**HARLEY QUINN**

**CATWOMAN**
**POISON IVY**

**ROBIN/CARRIE KELLEY**

Filming will be for one day at the Rachel Almond Dance Academy in Manchester. Filming would last for four hours. Payment would be Â£20 an hour. Applicants must be 18 years old and over. Also have great improvising skills. Applicant will have to provide their own costume for the role.

Please e-mail me at superheroes4@outlook.com if you're interested. Please include resume and headshot. I would appreciate it. Thanks.

items.title:
***FREE SOLO SHOW CLASS THIS SATURDAY ***

Hello Theatre Community!

***Are you â€¦
items.summary:
***FREE SOLO SHOW CLASS THIS SATURDAY ***

Hello Theatre Community!

***Are you curious about creating a ONE PERSON SHOW?***

Then you do not want to miss this 100% FREE solo theatre class "The Art of Creating the One Person Show" commencing THIS SAT SEPT 13TH @10AM (PST)/12pm (CST)/1pm (EST) via Zoom. 

RSVP HERE:

[https://www.soaringsolostudios.com/free-one-person-play-class/](https://www.soaringsolostudios.com/free-one-person-play-class/)

I have been teaching this ongoing FREE class for over a decade and I have been working in the genre of Solo Theatre for over 20 years. I have directed & developed well over 175 solo shows and toured successfully with my own award-winning solo shows, and I would be honored and excited to help guide YOU into your own success as a Solo Artist.

**ALL EXPERIENCE LEVELS WELCOME**, and no material needed to bring to the virtual class as I always provide a writing prompt. If you do have a solo excerpt you wish to share, that option will be available too.

All you need to attend this Zoom class is a willingness to explore, something to write with and on, and an RSVP here:

[https://www.soaringsolostudios.com/free-one-person-play-class/](https://www.soaringsolostudios.com/free-one-person-play-class/)

I truly hope you will join the Soaring Solo Community and I for this fabulous free virtual event. Let's turn your solo show dreams into an amazing reality!

Jessica Lynn

Founder & CEO of Soaring Solo Studios

Blogger for NoHo Arts

Director/Teaching Artist for the LA Women's Theatre Festival

Director & Developer of over 175 solo shows

[https://www.soaringsolostudios.com](https://www.soaringsolostudios.com/)

English and German in-person acting courses in Berlin and online globally with Isabelle Mann.

Isabelle is a degree holding international working actress, acting coach, and screenwriter.

Her work is influenced by a long-time collaboration with Robert Castle, a unique director renowned for the evolution of â€˜Method actingâ€™ and the founder of International Theatre New York, and Susan Batson, one of the most significant Hollywood acting coaches in the world.

Her method is based on â€˜Method actingâ€™, a technique originally created by Stanislavsky and further developed by Lee Strasberg, Stella Adler, and Sanford Meisner. The actor is trained to create the characterâ€™s life using the senses, in order to produce a reality. The actor discovers a physical and emotional availability that leads to working moment-to-moment, based on spontaneous organic impulses and their free expression through the character. The technique offers actors the freedom to be emotionally available, and artistically creative in both theatre and film.

Isabelle works with scenes and monologues from well-known playwrights such as Tennessee Williams, Edward Albee, William Shakespeare, Harold Pinter, Caryl Churchill, Alan Ayckbourn, Gotthold Ephraim Lessing, Sibylle Berg, Ingmar Bergman, Jean-Paul Sartre, Dario Fo & Franca Rame et al., film scripts or scenes of your choice.

Students she prepared for auditions at drama schools succeeded in gaining admission to institutions such as the renowned Ernst Busch Academy of Dramatic Arts in Berlin, or completed an acting degree at the Bern University of the Arts, performing the monologues they rehearsed with her. Actors she prepared for film and series roles were subsequently booked for their respective projects.

In addition to her acting career, she is also a certified life coach.

ACTING CLASSES FOR ALL LEVELS

From beginner to highly experienced film and stage actors.

â€¢Intensive individual preparation for auditions at theatres, drama schools or films.

â€¢Intensive individual preparation for film or stage roles.

â€¢Working on monologues and scenes.

â€¢Self-tape training and filming.

â€¢Speech and voice training.

â€¢Individual coaching to support your growth as an artist.

â€¢Insider tips, helping to find the right talent agent, networking tips, etc.

Contact: coaching@isabelle-mann.com

https://www.isabelle-mann.com/en/acting_coach.htm

#isabellemann #actor #actingcoach

***FREE SOLO SHOW CLASS THIS SATURDAY ***

Hello Theatre Community!

***Are you â€¦
items.summary:
***FREE SOLO SHOW CLASS THIS SATURDAY ***

Hello Theatre Community!

***Are you curious about creating a ONE PERSON SHOW?***

Then you do not want to miss this 100% FREE solo theatre class "The Art of Creating the One Person Show" commencing THIS SAT SEPT 13TH @10AM (PST)/12pm (CST)/1pm (EST) via Zoom. 

RSVP HERE:

[https://www.soaringsolostudios.com/free-one-person-play-class/](https://www.soaringsolostudios.com/free-one-person-play-class/)

I have been teaching this ongoing FREE class for over a decade and I have been working in the genre of Solo Theatre for over 20 years. I have directed & developed well over 175 solo shows and toured successfully with my own award-winning solo shows, and I would be honored and excited to help guide YOU into your own success as a Solo Artist.

**ALL EXPERIENCE LEVELS WELCOME**, and no material needed to bring to the virtual class as I always provide a writing prompt. If you do have a solo excerpt you wish to share, that option will be available too.

All you need to attend this Zoom class is a willingness to explore, something to write with and on, and an RSVP here:

[https://www.soaringsolostudios.com/free-one-person-play-class/](https://www.soaringsolostudios.com/free-one-person-play-class/)

I truly hope you will join the Soaring Solo Community and I for this fabulous free virtual event. Let's turn your solo show dreams into an amazing reality!

Jessica Lynn

Founder & CEO of Soaring Solo Studios

Blogger for NoHo Arts

Director/Teaching Artist for the LA Women's Theatre Festival

Director & Developer of over 175 solo shows

[https://www.soaringsolostudios.com](https://www.soaringsolostudios.com/)

items.title: Weâ€™re currently casting for**"**Fk (-) Boys"** (working title), a Berlin-based sâ€¦
items.summary:
Weâ€™re currently casting for**"**Fk (-) Boys"** (working title), a Berlin-based short fiction film directed by **Ilaria Tonetti**.
 

This emotionally raw, visually driven character piece follows a young woman through a night of unexpected connection, self-confrontation, and the fragile hope of healing.

**Location:** Berlin
**Shooting period:** 3â€“5 days between 9 and 13 July 2025
**Expenses:** Covered (no fee, travel & food included)

**Story**
After a breakup, Sofia â€“ wild, guarded and emotionally bruised â€“ meets a charming French stranger and spends one long night wandering through Berlin with him and her friends. But as the hours pass, she must face her fear of intimacy and decide whether sheâ€™s brave enough to let herself be seen, or whether sheâ€™ll retreat into the familiar pain she knows best.

**Roles:**

**SOFIA (Female, 20s)**

Energetic, provocative, emotionally layered. Sofia hides vulnerability behind bravado and chaos. A complex and contradictory presence: fierce on the outside, fragile underneath.

 

**THEO (Male, 20s)**

Charming, stylish, emotionally elusive. A golden boy with a hollow centre. Looks like he has it all but fears deep connection.

 

**ALICE (Female, 20s)**

Composed and elegant, the group's steadying force. She hides her dependence behind polished control, terrified of losing grip on who she thinks she is.

 

**MATILDE (Female, 20s)**

Sharp, rebellious, impulsive. The wildcard. She rejects love out loud but secretly longs for it â€“ and for Quillan.

 

**QUILLAN (Male, 20s)**

Gentle, romantic, emotionally present. The quiet heart of the group. Steady and sincere in a world of irony and games.

**Interested in auditioning?**
Please send your **CV**, **headshot**, **showreel (if available)** and a few lines about yourself to:
[00457876@metfilmstudents.de](mailto:00457876@metfilmstudents.de)

 

Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis. We welcome submissions from all backgrounds and identities.

items.title:
**Paid SHORT FILM (with Expenses)**

**'The Woman with the Rose in Her Hair' - Fâ€¦
items.summary:
**Paid SHORT FILM (with Expenses)**

**'The Woman with the Rose in Her Hair' - FEMALE LEAD **

**Title**: *Will I Ever See You Again*
**Location**: Gower, Swansea, South Wales, UK
**Shoot Dates**: 1 Shoot Day, (2 Travel Days either side - covered) - Late December 2025 - Early January 2026 (TBC)

Fee: **Â£300 plus Food, Travel and Hotel Accommodation Expenses Covered**

A cinematic, romantic and mysterious **dialogue-free** short film exploring memory, love, and identity â€” told through visuals and music. Inspired by Korean Group, **Red Velvetâ€™s** song *â€œWill I Ever See You Againâ€*, the story follows a man with dementia across two timelines, haunted by memories of his lost love.

Stylistically and thematically, the film is similar to the likes of *Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind*, *The Father*, and *Groundhog Day* â€” exploring memory, identity, and emotional connection through visual and poetic storytelling.

We're casting:

**Female Lead** â€“ 25â€“35, **Asian ethnicity** (North East/East/South East Asian) 
Elegant, expressive, romantic presence. No dialogue â€“ naturalistic charm (for flashback sequences) and subtle emotional expression and mystery (for the first half of the project).

Plans for Release:
Once completed, the film will be shared directly with **dementia and Alzheimerâ€™s care organizations** and their social media platforms as a creative tool to raise awareness and foster empathy around the emotional realities of living with memory loss.

The goal is to reach those affected by dementiaâ€”patients, families, and caregiversâ€”offering a heartfelt and human perspective on the fragility of memory and the powerful bonds we carry with us. As well as just tell a beautiful and sincere story.

To Apply:
Email **rossleyshon@gmail.com** with your **headshot** and **showreel. (*****Mandatory to apply*****) **

Hey Models,

I search a female model for my first music video, which will be recâ€¦
items.summary:
Hey Models,

I search a female model for my first music video, which will be recorded on the 11th of November in Berlin. 
I am a musician, living in Munich, doing a very special project in Berlin.

I will perform my original song â€Tabula Rasaâ€œ (unreleased) together with a robot, who plays the background guitar on a real electric guitar.
The video will be based on the performance of myself and the robot.

The morel should enter at the end of the video. Write me if you want to know more details.
You should be experienced in staying in front of a camera, age between 18-35 and having a lot of fun with this special project. I am highly low budget but I will do the best for giving you money.
You will need about 3 hours of time on the 11th of November.

You can write me here, on email (hmittermaier@berklee.edu) or WhatsApp (+49 151 217 589 57).

I hope to see you!

My name is Adelola Mary Haastrup, and Iâ€™m a passionate actress currently based in Nigeria. Iâ€™m looking to expand my career in the UK and am actively seeking opportunities for visa sponsorship.

I started acting at the age of 7, performing in stage productions. While much of my early work was in gospel theater, Iâ€™m not particularly religious, and my focus has always been on the craft of acting. Iâ€™m eager to explore a wide range of roles in film, TV, theater, and commercial work, and Iâ€™m excited to branch out into new genres and experiences.

In addition to my acting experience, I studied Music Technology with a major in Stage Performing Arts for 2 years , and I have full documentation of all my final projects from that time. This technical training complements my stage performance and has given me a comprehensive understanding of both the artistic and technical sides of the industry.

I was also part of a gospel drama group form 2011 to 2020 , where I won 4 "Card Awards," including Best Actress  (twice), Best Dressed, and Best Minister. These awards reflect my dedication to the craft, and Iâ€™m incredibly proud of them.

Iâ€™m looking forward to collaborating on a wide range of acting roles in the UKâ€™s vibrant and inclusive creative industry, and Iâ€™m actively seeking potential employers who are willing to support visa sponsorships for skilled performers like me.

If you have any leads or know of any production companies, agents, or casting opportunities, I would love to hear from you! Please feel free to DM me or comment below.

Thank you so much for your time and consideration. I look forward to connecting with you all!

items.summary:
[ğŸ‰](https://emojipedia.org/party-popper)CASTING PAID ROLES FOR PETS AND PET PARENTS [ğŸ‰](https://emojipedia.org/party-popper)

Veteos, a local veterinary video production company, is looking for pets for three specific scenes for social media clips for a veterinary financial company. We will be filming within the next month or so in Denver. W9 and signed release required. All scenes are about 2-3 hours of filming. The roles are below:

**Small Dog for a Spa Day** - ($300) Small dog and their pet parent enjoying a spa day. Pup must be able to lie still with a towel over them and on their head with some accessories (see example photo) to show the ultimate puppy spa day! To be considered, please send a video of your small dog lying in a similar position for 5-10 seconds to me via Facebook messenger. 

**Stuffed Animal Lover Dog** - ($300) Dog who LOVES stuffed animals - any stuffed animal! In this scene, we will be making a stuffy "come to life" with a life-size costume of a provided stuffy. Dog must love any and all stuffies, *even if new to them*. To be considered, please send a video of your dog loving their stuffed animals to me via Facebook messenger. 

**Cat Chasing Laser Pointer** - ($300) Cat who can easily follow and loves playing with a laser pointer with their pet parent. Filming location may be rented home or pet parents home depending on the cat's preference and comfort level.To be considered, please send in a video of your cat actively chasing a laser pointer to me via Facebook messenger. 

I can't wait to see your submission!

items.summary:
ğŸ“£ **LAST CALL FOR ACTORS!** We're making our final selections for a meaningful video and photo shoot this **Tuesday, September 16th**!

We're still looking for a few more great people to join our project.

We are specifically seeking:
* **Couples** who have a developed, genuine connection and are comfortable with each other on camera.
* **More men**, particularly those in their **40s and 50s**.

This is a paid lifestyle/documentary-style shoot for the **Begin Again Institute**, a behavioral health program that helps men with addiction and intimacy issues. The project aims to tell a powerful and authentic story. We will be capturing honest moments of connection, support, and reflection.

**Location:** Berthoud, Colorado 

**Pay:** $200 flat day rate (lunch provided) 

**Compensation:** This includes a perpetual buyout for website and marketing use.

To be considered for our final selections, please email your submission with the following:
* Recent headshot and one natural, unretouched photo.
* Your age, height, and contact info.
* Confirm your availability for Sept 16th.

Please send your submission to: **Danny@CaptivContent.com**

We're excited to hear from you!

items.title:
Project: LITTLE HOUSE ON THE PRAIRIE
Studio/Network: CBS STUDIOS / AC STUDIO / Nâ€¦
items.summary:
Project: LITTLE HOUSE ON THE PRAIRIE
Studio/Network: CBS STUDIOS / AC STUDIO / NETFLIX
Casting Director: Rachel Tenner
Showrunner/Exec. Producer: Rebecca Sonnenshine (The Boys, Vampire Diaries, Archive 81)
Exec. Producers: Joy Gorman Wettels for Joy Coalition, Trip Friendly for Friendly Family Productions & Dana Fox 
Director: Sarah Adina Smith
Shooting Location: Winnipeg, Canada
Shoot Dates: Approximately June to October 2025. Candidates must be able to be exclusively available for the entire period.
Submission Deadline: April 4th

Introduction: Based on the iconic book series written by Laura Ingalls Wilder, Netflixâ€™s Little House on the Prairie is an epic and thrilling family adventure of the mythic American West. Since its original publication in the 1930s, the LITTLE HOUSE book series and brand has remained a constant in the global zeitgeist. The classic novels have sold over 73 million copies in more than 100 countries, translated into at least 27 languages.

Project Synopsis: Part hopeful family drama, part epic survival tale, and part origin story of the American West, this fresh adaptation of Laura Ingalls Wilderâ€™s iconic semi-autobiographical Little House books offers a kaleidoscopic view of the struggles and triumphs of those who shaped the frontier.

Submission Instructions: 
1. Intro - Say your Name, Age, Height & Location (where you live) to the camera. Then zoom out to a full body shot. PLEASE put the intro in its own file. We do NOT want the intro on the same file as the scenes. Please label each audition file by Scene Number (S1, S2). Please submit only one take of each scene. 

2. Lighting & Sound - Please ensure that your face is well lit and that the external microphone is close enough to clearly understand what you are saying in the audition.

3. Framing & Taping - Please frame the shot from the top of head to mid chest. Please place the camera/phone somewhere stable like a tripod or a flat surface. If you are taping with a smart phone, please turn it horizontally. Do not do the scene directly to camera, but rather focus on the person reading the scene with you.  That reader should stand next to the camera.

4. Takes & Scenes - Please have another person read the other characters lines off-screen and stand next to the camera.  (please do not read the stage directions).

We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity. For every role, please submit qualified performers, without regard to disability, race, age, color, national origin, ethnic origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other basis prohibited by law. The persons and events depicted in this casting breakdown are fictitious. Any similarity to actual persons or events is unintentional.
Role(s): Download Sides: 

LAURA INGALLS
Character is a white Female, 9-11 years old. Laura is a disruptor. Honest to a fault. Questions authority. She is observant, tender more... strong-willed, hot-tempered. She resists the bounds of 19th-century ladylike behavior â€” she likes to hunt and run barefoot and feel the sun on her face. She is curious and optimistic and fearless and is quick to confront anyone who is cruel or unjust. She loves fiercely and unapologetically and is utterly devoted to her dog, Jack. She absorbs every detail she sees around her, collecting them for stories she will someday share with the world. SERIES REGULAR less...

Drama short film

Filming around Denver, Colorado inâ€¦
items.summary:
Casting Call: *Fossilized*

Drama short film

Filming around Denver, Colorado in fall 2025

Unpaid, nonunionâ€“ food and transportation will be provided.

Log line: When a young paleontologistâ€™s grandmother begins to forget who she is, she runs away to search for proof of her past.

Roles:

Linnie: female, 7-11 years old; Linnie is a responsible 8 year old with a passion for paleontology who lives with her grandmother.

There is a two-year time difference between flashback sequences and the main timeline of the filmâ€“ ideally, actresses auditioning should be able to pass for both 8-9 years old and 6-7 years old when styled differently.

Nana: female, 60-70 years old; Nana is Linnie's grandmother and guardian. When Linnie was placed in her care, she was a loving and capable guardian, but she has started to show signs of dementia.

Sophie: female, 7-11 years old; a high energy nine year old, Sophie is Linnie's best friend and loudest supporter.

Mr. Jake: male, 28-35 years old; A kind elementary school teacher who tries his best to look out for his stepdaughter Sophie and her best friend Linnie.

To audition, please apply through our Backstage page or send a self-tape to *Arthurr1904s@gmail.com* using the sides provided below.

Link to Backstage page:

[https://www.backstage.com/casting/fossilized-2978771/](https://www.backstage.com/casting/fossilized-2978771/)

**We are looking for actors for the shooting of a short movie we wilâ€¦
items.summary:
**Hello,**

**We are looking for actors for the shooting of a short movie we will be filming at Trebas.**

**Here is the information :**

**Production title**: A Killer on the Run

**Unionized / Non-unionized**: Non-unionized

**Production Type**: Student

**Project duration**: Short film (10 minutes)

**Production company: **Trebas Institute

**Director: **Daniel Langlois Houle

**Casting director: Jean-Philippe LÃ©vesque**

**Location of the hearing: **550 Sherbrooke West

**Location of the filming **: Montreal

**Courriel** : dave198816@icloud.com

**Compensation **: Non

**Auditions **: 11-25-2024 / 11-26-2023

**Start of filming** : 15-01-2024

**End of filming: **16-01-2024

**Synopsis**

One Saturday morning, the charismatic and seductive MathÃ©o, graduating from the Shivers Film Institute, auditions to produce his script with Ben Sirois, a renowned producer. The meeting quickly takes a dramatic turn and becomes a matter of life and death for the two men. Who will survive the hearing? It's up to you to find out!

**Character descriptions**

MATHÃ‰O: 30 YEARS OLD, GRADUATING AT THE SHIVERS CINEMA INSTITUTE. ATTRACTIVE AND VERY CHARMING, HE WANTS TO BECOME A DIRECTOR AND SCREENWRITER. THROUGH HIS MUSCULAR APPEARANCE AND THE IMPRESSION OF HAVING EVERYTHING GOING FOR HIM, HE IS READY TO MAKE THE NECESSARY EFFORTS TO MAKE HIS DREAMS COME TRUE.

BEN SIROIS: 40 YEARS OLD AND RENOWNED PRODUCER IN THE FILM INDUSTRY. IT IS VICIOUS AND INAPPROPRIATE. ONE LOOK AT HIM IS ENOUGH TO UNDERSTAND THAT HE IS FULL OF BAD INTENTIONS AND THAT HE IS READY TO DO ANYTHING TO ACHIEVE HIS ENDS.

GEORGE: 50 YEARS OLD AND JANITOR AT THE SHIVERS INSTITUTE. HE IS POLITE, SYMPHATIC AND HELPFUL. HE IS A MAN OF SIMPLE APPEARANCE AND WITHOUT HISTORY.

**Thanks in advance for the answer. We await it with enthusiasm.**

**Sincerely,**

**JP LÃ©vesque**

items.summary:
Casting Call! Warrington/Manchester area, late October/early November filming dates

We are looking for one Female and one Male actor to play the lead roles in our upcoming short film, â€˜Oh, Deathâ€™, a comedy drama exploring themes of choice, family, death and morality. Synopsis below;

After his abrupt and unexpected death, Peter is almost elated to be greeted by an Agent of Death and to discover that there is an afterlife. Peter believes heâ€™s done enough good to earn his ticket Up, but when sarcastic and bored Margo tells him heâ€™s going Down, Peter has only a short time to convince her to change her mind to avoid an eternity of punishment.

The Roles-

Peter- 
Male
Age- 35-45

Margo- 
Female

items.title: Question for Americans who have acted in the UK:  I am being required to get Pubâ€¦
items.summary: Question for Americans who have acted in the UK:  I am being required to get Public Liability Insurance.  This seems to be an easy thing to get for UK citizens.  It comes with their version of Equity dues.  However, UK insurance companies won't cover me as I am not a citizen.  US companies either don't know what I'm talking about or offer me a policy that costs $2500/year to start with.  How have you handled PLI working in the UK?

items.title: Hello! Two casting calls! Auditions are either first come first serve or remote â€¦
items.summary:
Hello! Two casting calls! Auditions are either first come first serve or remote depending on which role you want! 

**FIRST:**

**Title: **I have (transference)

**Genre**: Weird comedy

**Logline:** A woman's therapist thinks she's hitting on him but she insists that she's just been referencing stand-up comic Tom Papa this whole time. 

**Role:** Jeremy, 30s, male, any ethnicity. Therapist, Buddhist, loves hiking, gives people the benefit of the doubt. But this situation is just a little too doubtful. 

**Film date**: Unknown, but most likely a weekend in October. One day

**Location:** Unknown, but most likely in Aurora CO.

**Compensation:** None but free lunch & gas

***SECOND:***

**Title:** The Baseball Bat

**Genre: **Comedic Thriller

**Logline**: Jake has tools to manage his anxiety now. But he comes across his biggest hurdle yet: chaperoning a group of detention students who learn that faking a concussion can get them out of class early. Will this prove to be too much for him or will he finally resolve a worry on his own? 

**Roles:** Students, ages 7-14. All genders and ethnicities. You'll be extras but you'll be able to improvise your own lines!

**Shooting date**: Unknown, because we still have to find a school that'd be willing to let me film there, but hopefully some time in October or November, most likely soon after school gets let out on a weekday. Only one day. 

**Shooting location**: Also unknown, but definitely a school of some sort either in the Denver or Aurora area. 

Kindly email me at jakewunger@gmail.com or text at 571.276.4722 if interested! All extras welcome (no auditions necessary) and Jeremy applicants should get an email with a prompt for remote auditions within the next two weeks. Thanks!

**OPEN AUDITIONS**

**We are based in Myrtle Beach but travel**

**For appointment and sides email Head Shot & Resume to**

**Anthony.kateridge@yahoo.com**

 

           We are looking for 2 cast members to work on our traveling team of actors for our lighthearted murder mystery centered around a wacky Mob family. YOU MUST HAVE GOOD IMPROV CHOPS show is totally interactive with the audience from the second they walk into the venue. Show is very flexible lots of room for improv script is more of a guideline as long as storyline stays constant. The killer, victim and the reason for the murder WILL change nightly. Actors must OWN their characters and make the part their own at the same time be able to leave their egos at the door. We are all equals in this cast Eventually all actors should be able to switch roles with each other making for fun and different scenarios.

** **

**Tina / Tommy (30 + Male or Female):** Wanna be singer the boss is trying to push. Boss has record company people there to see performance even though he has never heard *him or her sing* Only knows son -in- law says singer constantly sings at Pizzeria. Prefer someone that cannot sing a note although if you can sing, we can work that into the show. Day job is pizza maker in the Pizza Business run by Boss' son-in-law. Female singer acts like they are the best since Cher / Celine Dion and Male acts like he is Tom Jones/Elvis & Mick Jager all rolled into one

 

 

**ANGIE CANNOLLI***** (*****Female 30+)**

She is Food and Beverage Manger at this event.  She works for her Dads Legit business and only hired her husband to be here tonight, as the group was so huge. items.title:
**Project Type**: Feature Film
**Casting Locations**: New York City, NY; Miami, â€¦
items.summary:
**Project Type**: Feature Film
**Casting Locations**: New York City, NY; Miami, FL, London
**Roles**:
* **Pandora**: Day Player, Female, 25â€“30
* **Newscaster**: Lead, Female, 30â€“45
* **Radicaux Member**: Day Player, Female, 25â€“30

**IMDB: **[https://www.imdb.com/title/tt16121314/](https://www.imdb.com/title/tt16121314/)

**Production:** Manhattan Project Films
1. **Pandora** (Day Player, Female, 25â€“30)

**Role Description**:
Pandora is a mysterious and enigmatic figure who appears at a pivotal moment in the film. She is not bound by conventional morality and operates in the gray areas of the law. Her motivations are unclear, and she serves as both an ally and a potential threat to the protagonist.

**Character Traits**:
* **Appearance**: Striking and memorable, with an unconventional beauty that draws attention.
* **Personality**: Charismatic and manipulative, with a calm demeanor that hides a calculating mind.
* **Skills**: Highly intelligent, resourceful, and adept at reading people.
* **Backstory**: Little is known about her past, adding to her mystique.

**Character Arc**:
Pandora's role is to challenge the protagonist's perceptions and decisions, pushing them to confront their own moral compass. Her true intentions remain ambiguous throughout the film, keeping both the protagonist and the audience on edge

2. **Newscaster** (Lead, Female, 30â€“45)

**Role Description**:
The Newscaster is the voice of authority and information in the film. She anchors the narrative's exposition, delivering crucial updates and insights that drive the plot forward. Her reports are often the first indication of escalating events in the city.

**Character Traits**:
* **Appearance**: Professional and polished, with a commanding presence.
* **Personality**: Composed, articulate, and empathetic, with a strong sense of duty.
* **Skills**: Exceptional communication abilities, quick thinking, and a deep understanding of the city's dynamics.
* **Backstory**: A seasoned journalist with years of experience in the field, she has witnessed the city's transformation over time.

**Character Arc**:
The Newscaster's role is to provide context and clarity amidst the chaos. As the story unfolds, her reports become more urgent and personal, reflecting the growing tension and her own emotional investment in the events.

3. **Radicaux Member** (Day Player, Female, 25â€“30)

**Role Description**:
The Radicaux Member is a passionate and dedicated activist involved in underground movements. She is a catalyst for change, challenging the status quo and advocating for the marginalized. Her actions are driven by a deep-seated belief in justice and equality.

**Character Traits**:
* **Appearance**: Edgy and distinctive, with a style that reflects her rebellious nature.
* **Personality**: Determined, fearless, and persuasive, with a strong moral compass.
* **Skills**: Organizational prowess, public speaking, and strategic planning.
* **Backstory**: Raised in a community that valued activism, she has been involved in various causes from a young age.

**Character Arc**:
The Radicaux Member's journey is one of sacrifice and resilience. She faces numerous challenges and setbacks but remains steadfast in her mission. Her actions inspire others and serve as a reminder of the power of collective action.

items.summary:
Audition Notice
â€œScrooge! (Abbreviated Version)â€ 

Book, Music and Lyrics by Leslie Bricusse

From A Christmas Carol by Charles Dickens

A one-hour adaptation of the crowd-pleasing holiday musical!

In 1970, renowned writer/composer/lyricist Leslie Bricusse adapted the classic Charles Dickens tale A Christmas Carol into the hit screen musical Scrooge! 

A charming stage musical, Scrooge! 

Lyons Community Theatre

Auditions: Will be held at Planet Bluegrass Lab Building(Directions), on Friday, Oct 3rd, 5-7pm; Sunday, Oct 5th,  1-3pm and Monday, Oct 6th, 5-7pm  (If none of these days or times work for you, please contact georgi.pollard@gmail.com by Sunday, Oct 5th @12pm

Performance dates:

Friday, December 12th, 2025 @7pm 

Saturday, December 13th, 2025 @2pm & 7pm

Sunday, December 14th, 2025 @2pm 

@Planet Bluegrass Wildflower Pavillion 

All auditioners  will be asked to sing 16 measures from the musical or a verse from a familiar holiday song.

We will dance a few moves and those wanting a speaking role will read from the script. Everyone is encouraged to show off your English accent!  Although not necessary, you are welcome to bring a prepared song to share.  We will have an accompanist.

Roles are Non-Union | Unpaid

LCT encourages actors of all races, ethnicities, genders, ages, and abilities all ages to audition, welcoming performers from all backgrounds.

Performers may come on any one of the days or you may sign up using the Signup Genius link

items.title:
CASTING CALL

SITE SPECIFIC THEATRE 

Experienced and serious actor with strong â€¦
items.summary:
CASTING CALL

SITE SPECIFIC THEATRE 

Experienced and serious actor with strong focus, intuition and comic timing needed for a single person site specific English language play, that takes place in a car with only four audience members (who are also in the car). Age and gender is not specified. Must be available for performances in late-May or April with a month of rehearsal before. Pay is from ticket sales profit share, with majority to the performer. Performance will be presented under the umbrella of a Berlin performance venue.

Short pitch: Four people are invited to view a car for sale, what unfolds is a touching and strange monologue from the seller about modern alienation, the death of ennui and the managed decline of our futures. With their headspace stuck somewhere between an endlessly distracted doom scroll and a deep and meaningful, the seller tries to attempt to truly connect with the possible buyers. All whilst being unsure if they can actually let go of the sacred decaying automobile.

For archive and promotion much of the dress rehearsal will be filmed with cinema cameras and produced to a high standard not normally available to underground theatre. Whilst the number of audience members will be very limited this video and promotional material will be of a very high standard. 

About me: I'm a Melbourne born, Berlin/London based film director diving back into theatre after a long hiatus. A creative space I'm looking forward to diving into in site specific experimental pieces over the coming year. Iâ€™m on the hunt for performers in Berlin hungry to do thought provoking, fresh and intense work. The world is on fire. Letâ€™s make things that we can be proud of, before weâ€™re all burnt. You can see a large portfolio of my film work here: [**https://vimeo.com/timkelly**]

Before April 10, please email relevant portfolio materials to: [timothygeorgekelly@gmail.com] with subject: â€œCarpark Castingâ€

items.title:
# CASTING CALL: JOIN OUR ACTING PODCAST

When a group of actors sit around a tabâ€¦
items.summary:
# CASTING CALL: JOIN OUR ACTING PODCAST

When a group of actors sit around a table and use their spoken words to portray characters all going on an adventure together, that's called a tabletop roleplaying game (TTRPG). Our gaming group plays a variety of tabletop roleplaying games and publishes the audio as a podcast. Example famous ttrpg podcasts: Critical Role, The Adventure Zone, etc. We react as our character to the scenario presented by the game master. We respond to challenges, overcome obstacles, make jokes and laugh with our fellow acting friends. Would you enjoy acting in-character for a podcast audience? Join us.

# When we play:

Weekends. Both European and American time zones. Joining us doesn't commit you to every weekend. Instead, we pick games we want to try and sign up for those calendar spots.

# How long we play / what itâ€™s like:

Our members sit at their microphones for four hours talking their way through an adventure using their words and laughter to entertain each other. We use theater of the mind, saying out loud how far away targets are instead of looking at combat maps on a screen. The recordings are high quality, and we air the audio as a podcast. Donâ€™t worry, we donâ€™t publish our names or faces.

# System played:

We get to learn and play a different tabletop roleplaying game (ttrpg) system each session. Thereâ€™s no financial burden to you. The systems are either free to everyone or we were sent a free promotional copy from its creator.

# Oneshot or campaign:

Both. Like a traditional campaign, we repeatedly meet familiar non player characters (NPCs), facing challenges and experiencing long term character growth. We play our same character for a year. Our characters start at low power in January, grow to epic max fighting strength by December, then retire. Like a oneshot, each individual episode opens with a beginning to its plot, and the exploration of its story ends after four hours.

# Game Mastering (GMing):

We rotate so that everyone is invited to be a player and a game master if they want. The GM gets to pick which ttrpg we play that weekend. If you find a fun ttrpg you want to try, you can sign up as the GM and be confident that there will be players excited to play with you. If you prefer to be a player every time thatâ€™s cool, too. Our members don't have to GM ever if they want a break from it. Getting to pick how often you GM really helps relieve burnout. GM as often as makes you happy.

# You can vibe check past games:

We're on itunes, spotify, youtube, and all the podcast apps. Our cast rotates. Skip around and listen to snippets from a few episodes to see which of our members you want to play with first. The episodes aren't all great, but we have fun together. This isn't a job. It's a hobby, a way to relax and laugh meeting new people who slowly over time become lifelong friends. It's okay to miss games; you arenâ€™t expected to be present for every session. The opt-in format naturally minimizes table trouble because you can see whoâ€™s signed up to GM and play in a game before you join it, and can pick dates that have people youâ€™re looking forward to playing with.

# Joining:

To join, email us at FirebreathingKittensPodcast at gmail dot com and tell us about your equipment. Our minimum requirement is 24 bit audio (not 16 bit). If you donâ€™t know what 24 bit audio means thatâ€™s not a problem, the new members tab of FirebreathingKittensPodcast dot com has an equipment section that explains what all the microphone words mean with pictures and videos. We welcome members of all experience levels and will train you. The new members tab also has info about our format and answers to frequently asked questions. Minimum age 21 years old. We reply to all emails from people who have 24 bit audio within three days with a support agreement for you to sign, and then will guide you through character creation and train you how to record great audio.

We are looking to create two "duos" that know each other (so each child has a friend they know on the shoot) - this can be brothers, sisters, friends, cousins, neighbours.. racheldesmarestcastingbox@gmail.com

items.title:
****Casting Call****
We are looking for enthusiastic, reliable people who just lâ€¦
items.summary:
****Casting Call****
We are looking for enthusiastic, reliable people who just love Christmas and want to help to create some magical memories for our visiting families.

You must be able to improvise and remain in your character at all times. Full training will be given.

Our standards are very high and our reputation is very well known locally for providing a magical family Christmas Experience that is affordable to all. We are a happy, professional team and you will be provided with excellent working conditions. Many of our seasonal staff have been with us for many years, which speaks volumes.

Must be local to CM36HB, Essex and have transport to get to and from the venue (as public transport is not reliable in our area).

We run from mid November to, and including the 23rd December. You do not have to commit to every opening day but you will need to work at least 16 sessions (long days are classed as 2 sessions).

Open to everyone over the age of 16

We are open weekends and once we get to December also after school.

We are looking for:
Santa - natural beard preferred but we do provide top quality, human hair beards. Must have a wholesome attitude to Christmas
Mother Christmas - someone who will make the children feel at ease but who can control a section of elves
Elves - we have elves of all ages, we just need enthusiasm and a fun loving attitude
Train Driver for The Santa Express

If you think you would be perfect, please email info@thepartykingdom.co.uk telling us why you would be perfect, which character you would like to play and include a headshot

Renumeration will vary depending on the character and previous experience and will be confirmed once we have received your email.
We cannot wait to hear form you xxx

We are The Easy English Theatre and we are looking for actors and actresses.

The Easy English Theatre ([https://www.divadloanglicky.cz/](https://www.divadloanglicky.cz/)) is a unique project that brings language education to Czech students in a fun and engaging way.

We will be doing a 2-week tour from 3rd to 14th November 2025. The tour will take place in multiple Czech cities, and performances will be held in theatres and cultural centres with capacities of 300â€“500 people. The schedule runs Monday to Friday, mornings until lunchtime only.

We are looking for one young woman and one young man with an acting age of 18â€“25. We are specifically looking for native British English speakers who enjoy working with children and teenagers and would like to discover some beautiful parts of the Czech Republic.

We will cover all expenses (accommodation, food, travel) and offer a fee of Â£600 per week.

If you're interested, please send us a short video showcasing yourself as an actor to divadloanglicky@gmail.com.

items.title:
Hey peeps in Kansas or peeps who know peeps in Kansas!!
I'm doing a casting thatâ€¦
items.summary:
Hey peeps in Kansas or peeps who know peeps in Kansas!!
I'm doing a casting that is specificaly looking for real Kansans. Is that how you say it? I should know, I married a green eye'd Kansas boy... but anyway, back to the point. I'm looking for a bunch of people and they can be from anywhere in the state. The filming team will come to you or at least pretty darn close to you.
The pay is $500 per person - even if your whole family books it
Usage: OOH, CTV, Social, Web, Print, Banners, Industrial, in perpetuity
It'd be awesome if you were actual BCBS customers, but you don't have to be! And you don't need to have any on camera experience.
If you fit the bill, please send an email with a photo of you and a little blurb about you and why you fit the project. Send it to shauna@sebcasting.com by end of day Friday Aug 29th.
Here are some specific people we're looking for, but we are also loking for just your regular Kansas folks too.
1) Farmer - Weâ€™re looking for a real farmer, any age, who works the land while managing a visible health challenge. This could be a prosthetic arm, an insulin pump, a hearing aid, or anything that shows their body has been through something and they are still out there doing the work and living their life.
This is not about overcoming a set-back in a glossy, commercial way. It is about the everyday toughness of someone who gets up before sunrise, feeds the animals, fixes the tractor, and keeps going. Dirt under the nails, sun on the face, humor in the voice. Someone who looks like they actually know what calluses feel like.
All races and genders are welcome. We want authenticity over polish. People not pretending to be farmers but real ones.
2) A student athlete - A real-deal young athlete, age 15â€“20, whoâ€™s currently in the thick of rehabbing a noticeable injury. This could be an ACL, ankle, shoulder. Something that leaves a brace, crutches, or scar, something that we as the viewer can see and feel in a split second.
Weâ€™re not shooting for shiny highlight reels or staged comebacks. We want the raw in-between. A kid still rocking the team hoodie at physical therapy. The one who hears the squeak of the gym floor but has to watch from the sideline. Someone with grit, humor, and honesty in how they carry themselves.
All races and backgrounds are welcome. Weâ€™re especially interested in faces and stories that look like real life, not polished models, or someone who is playing a role, but the real people. They should have a look of determination on their face. This isnâ€™t a set-back but a stage for what comes next.
3) A graveyard shift worker - This isnâ€™t about polished smiles or hero shots. Itâ€™s the tired eyes at 3 a.m., the coï¬€ee that barely keeps you upright, the quiet moments in fluorescent light when the world feels stuck in pause. Someone who looks like they know what it feels like to walk out of work and see the sun rise before theyâ€™ve even gone to bed.
All races, genders, and ages are welcome. We want someone real, not staged. A person who carries the weight of the night shift in the way they stand, move, and speak.
Prefer BCBS members
4) A 4H kid - Weâ€™re not after a glossy champion. We want the kid who smells like hay by noon, whose boots are dusty, and whose face says theyâ€™ve been up since sunrise. Someone who knows long rides in a pickup, the heat that sticks to your skin, and the noise of the barns drowning out the noise of the competition.
All races and backgrounds welcome. We want real Kansas kids who treat the fairgrounds like a second home, kids who know the dust, the heat, and the rhythm of competition better than the tourists ever will.
5) Hunters & Fishers - We are looking for real Kansans. Not models, not overly polished actors, but people who tell the true story of this state. People who represent Kansas in the way they stand, the way they work, the way they are. Our audience should be able to look at them and
think: that could be me, that could be my neighbor, that could be my family.
We are not looking for perfection. We are looking for authenticity. Lives that have been well-lived. Hands that show they have worked. Eyes that carry both resilience and pride.
People that without a single word,but a single look, can tell you where they are from and what they stand for, in an instant.
This cast should feel like Kansas itself, wide, varied, and diverse. From big cities, small towns, and open plains. Every age, every background, and every walk of life. People whose presence says something true before they even have to talk.
6) Fossil diggers/Rock hounds - We are not looking for perfection. We are looking for authenticity. Lives that have been well-lived. Hands that show they have worked. Eyes that carry both resilience and pride.
People that without a single word,but a single look, can tell you where they are from and what they stand for, in an instant.
This cast should feel like Kansas itself, wide, varied, and diverse. From big cities, small towns, and open plains. Every age, every background, and every walk of life. People whose presence says something true before they even have to talk.
7) College students - Young people who tell the story of campus life in Kansas. We are looking for real Kansans. Not models, not overly polished actors, but people who
tell the true story of this state. People who represent Kansas in the way they stand, the
way they work, the way they are. Our audience should be able to look at them and think: that could be me, that could be my neighbor, that could be my family. We are not looking for perfection. We are looking for authenticity. This cast should feel like Kansas itself, wide, varied, and diverse. From big cities, small
towns, and open plains. Every age, every background, and every walk of life. People whose presence says something true before they even have to talk.

items.title: Calling all Denver film students! Are you ready to get some serious hands-on expâ€¦
items.summary:
Calling all Denver film students! Are you ready to get some serious hands-on experience and build your portfolio with a project that's anything but ordinary? We're seeking talented and enthusiastic crew members for our short film, "And Then Jeff Killed Everyone" a dark comedy horror that twists the tropes of found footage and paranormal investigation shows.

This is an unpaid opportunity, but it's an incredible chance to contribute to a unique vision and gain valuable on-set experience that will help boost your reel and resume.

We're specifically looking for:

**Editor** **(Familiar with Found Footage & Paranormal Show Tropes)**

We need an editor who lives and breathes the aesthetics of found footage and paranormal investigation TV shows. Think jump cuts, shaky cam, sudden audio spikes, and the slow, creeping dread of a ghost hunt gone wrong. Your keen eye for pacing and your ability to craft tension and unexpected comedic beats will be essential. This is a chance to show off your understanding of genre conventions and subvert them!

**Makeup Artists** **(Specializing in Gore Effects)**

We're on the hunt for makeup artists with a flair for gore effects. Our script features some truly memorable (and messy) moments, and we need your skills to make them look horrifyingly real. This is your chance to showcase your practical effects abilities and create striking visuals for your portfolio.

If you're passionate about filmmaking and eager to gain practical experience on a project that defies expectations, we want to hear from you!

**Submit your reel/portfolio and resume to chrismusick23@gmail.com**

items.title: Hey Denver actors & acting students! Are you looking for an incredible opportuniâ€¦
items.summary:
Hey Denver actors & acting students! Are you looking for an incredible opportunity to build your reel, gain valuable set experience, and bring a unique character to life on screen? We're casting for ***"And Then Jeff Killed Everyone,"*** a dark comedy horror pilot that playfully twists the paranormal investigation genre.

This is an unpaid student film, but it's a chance to work on a distinctive script, get high-quality footage for your reel, and connect with a passionate local film crew. We're looking for dedicated actors to fill these roles:

**Available Roles:**
* **Don Logins: **(Male, 20s-30s) Think Zak Bagans and Ed Hardy t-shirts. He's intense, self-indulgent, with gelled hair and an over-the-top style. Don is convinced of his own coolness and obsessed with proving ghosts are real, mostly for the fame. A fantastic opportunity for an actor who can lean into an exaggerated, yet committed, performance.
* **Nicole:** (Female, 20s-30s) Our kind, soft-spoken, and friendly Team Case Researcher. She's genuinely passionate about finding evidence of life after death and grounds the team with her sincerity. This role needs an actor who can convey warmth and a quiet determination.
* **Casey:** (Male, 20s-30s) Very intelligent and level-headed, with a dry wit. He approaches the paranormal with a healthy dose of skepticism but genuinely wants to see a ghost. We're looking for an actor who can deliver intelligent humor and a grounded presence.
* **Frankie:** (Male, 20s-30s) From Boston with a heavy accent, Frankie's a bit squirrelly and prone to screwing up. He's more of a film student than a paranormal investigator, initially a skeptic, and often finds himself in over his head. Great for an actor who excels at physical comedy and portrays nervous energy.
* **Stefania:** (Female, 20s-40s) A very no-nonsense medium with a Natasha Lyonne-type vibe. She's mostly nice to others but can be blunt. She claims to be a medium but is well aware that many think it's BS (and thinks those people can screw themselves). This role is perfect for an actor who can balance a strong, confident personality with comedic timing and a subtle layer of deception.

**If you're ready to dive into a fun and memorable project, please submit your headshot and resume to Chrismusick23@gmail.com. We can't wait to see your auditions!**

items.title:
This is me (and Zoe), ten years into a journey that almost never started.

At 47â€¦
items.summary:
This is me (and Zoe), ten years into a journey that almost never started.

At 47, after a 16-year break, I tried to relaunch my acting career in Germany with no reel, no contacts, and very rusty skills. I had no idea how to explain the gap on my resume, and the thought of walking into a casting room again terrified me.

But giving up was not an option.

The solution hit me when I realized the problem itself was pointing the way forward. I needed training in English at a high level, and it did not exist in Munich. Flying to London, LA, or New York was unrealistic.

So I organized the workshops myself.

What happened next changed everything.

Instead of stumbling around in the dark trying to figure it out again, I could hit the ground running. Whenever I needed something like showreel material, headshots, the right kind of training, I organized it and got what I needed. If I had tried to piece it all together on my own, it would have taken ten times as long, and I did not have that kind of time.

That approach became my foundation. It is what eventually opened doors to work with studios like A24, Netflix, and Hallmark.

Along the way, I got world-class training for free as the organizer. A community of actors formed around those workshops. And unexpectedly, it also turned into steady income.

Here is the breakthrough: I always believed you had to "make it" before you could make money as a creative. What I discovered is that the journey itself can pay for itself.

Use what you need, whether that is training, practice, connections, or visibility, and shape it into something that lets other people get what they need too. That way you move your craft forward, build real relationships, get seen, and the process funds itself.

At first, I thought this only worked for actors because that is where I started. But the more I shared my story, the more I heard the same frustrations from other creatives: photographers, writers, artisans, even people into things like fermentation or traditional crafts. That's when it clicked. This approach is not just about acting. It can work anywhere someone is willing to use what they need to build what they want.

Ten years later, I am still living this way. I am constantly building skills, deepening connections, getting more visible in my craft, and funding it all as I go.

I am sharing this because I know too many people who keep their passions in the "someday" box. They wait until they feel "ready" or "expert enough" before letting themselves imagine it could actually support them.

But what if the very thing you think is holding you back is actually your starting point to a creative life that fits?

ğŸ‘‰ For me, it was not having reel material or training. Whatâ€™s been that thing for you?

items.title:
# CASTING CALL: JOIN OUR ACTING PODCAST

When a group of actors sit around a tabâ€¦
items.summary:
# CASTING CALL: JOIN OUR ACTING PODCAST

When a group of actors sit around a table and use their spoken words to portray characters all going on an adventure together, that's called a tabletop roleplaying game (TTRPG). Our gaming group plays a variety of tabletop roleplaying games and publishes the audio as a podcast. Example famous ttrpg podcasts: Critical Role, The Adventure Zone, etc. We react as our character to the scenario presented by the game master. We respond to challenges, overcome obstacles, make jokes and laugh with our fellow acting friends. Would you enjoy acting in-character for a podcast audience? Join us.

# When we play:

Weekends. Both European and American time zones. Joining us doesn't commit you to every weekend. Instead, we pick games we want to try and sign up for those calendar spots.

# How long we play / what itâ€™s like:

Our members sit at their microphones for four hours talking their way through an adventure using their words and laughter to entertain each other. We use theater of the mind, saying out loud how far away targets are instead of looking at combat maps on a screen. The recordings are high quality, and we air the audio as a podcast. Donâ€™t worry, we donâ€™t publish our names or faces.

# System played:

We get to learn and play a different tabletop roleplaying game (ttrpg) system each session. Thereâ€™s no financial burden to you. The systems are either free to everyone or we were sent a free promotional copy from its creator.

# Oneshot or campaign:

Both. Like a traditional campaign, we repeatedly meet familiar non player characters (NPCs), facing challenges and experiencing long term character growth. We play our same character for a year. Our characters start at low power in January, grow to epic max fighting strength by December, then retire. Like a oneshot, each individual episode opens with a beginning to its plot, and the exploration of its story ends after four hours.

# Game Mastering (GMing):

We rotate so that everyone is invited to be a player and a game master if they want. The GM gets to pick which ttrpg we play that weekend. If you find a fun ttrpg you want to try, you can sign up as the GM and be confident that there will be players excited to play with you. If you prefer to be a player every time thatâ€™s cool, too. Our members don't have to GM ever if they want a break from it. Getting to pick how often you GM really helps relieve burnout. GM as often as makes you happy.

# You can vibe check past games:

We're on itunes, spotify, youtube, and all the podcast apps. Our cast rotates. Skip around and listen to snippets from a few episodes to see which of our members you want to play with first. The episodes aren't all great, but we have fun together. This isn't a job. It's a hobby, a way to relax and laugh meeting new people who slowly over time become lifelong friends. It's okay to miss games; you arenâ€™t expected to be present for every session. The opt-in format naturally minimizes table trouble because you can see whoâ€™s signed up to GM and play in a game before you join it, and can pick dates that have people youâ€™re looking forward to playing with.

# Joining:

To join, email us at FirebreathingKittensPodcast at gmail dot com and tell us about your equipment. Our minimum requirement is 24 bit audio (not 16 bit). If you donâ€™t know what 24 bit audio means thatâ€™s not a problem, the new members tab of FirebreathingKittensPodcast dot com has an equipment section that explains what all the microphone words mean with pictures and videos. We welcome members of all experience levels and will train you. The new members tab also has info about our format and answers to frequently asked questions. Minimum age 21 years old. We reply to all emails from people who have 24 bit audio within three days with a support agreement for you to sign, and then will guide you through character creation and train you how to record great audio.

items.summary:
American actors in Montreal? 

We are looking for american speaking male talents to audition for a Non Union voice and motion capture project ''Washington Irving's Hologram''. 
Voice should sound 40-55 years old but it's ok if you look younger. No beards
This casting welcomes submissions from all backgrounds
 
Project: Village of Sleepy Hollow near New York
Rate is 1500$ Non Union
Recording date: Week of July 4th
Production type: Mocap, hologram for a circus
Recording duration: 1 full day with Mocap
Deadline for submissions : Monday June 27th @ 12 pm

Role description:
Looking for a very good actor who can voice a learned six minute monologue for a holographic depiction of Washington Irving, writer of â€œThe Legend of Sleepy Hollowâ€. This role requires a  sounding American Accent. The actor cannot be claustrophobic. He will have to wear a motion capture suit + facial capture helmet.

Submissions:
Please forward self-tapes visual auditions to sondageperspectives@gmail.com with the following assets:
- A video recording of yourself acting the suggested highlighted lines
- A resume and picture if one is available

Note: Only your voice will be showcased for 4 weeks during the Winchester Art Circus presentation with the other characters at 5 presentations per week.
See below the link  and script :
 
script : 
â€œI sealed this letter 200 years ago with the promise to return to tell the REAL story of what I meant by â€œThe Legendâ€. And that time has now come...
Well nowâ€¦this is quite the cozy gathering. Welcome. I am Washington Irving.
This is an old story I have to tell, a two-hundred year old story of ghosts and goblins, guile and gullibility, of contests and conquests.
Youâ€™ll see some rivalry, a dose of unrequited infatuation, a handful of greed and bullying. But at the bottom of it all, when you get down to the last draw of your ale, itâ€™s just the plain nature of the human condition that tells its own story...in a most peculiar way.
Itâ€™s said that legends are the tall tales told to make sense of the things too great, or too terrifying to believe.
The thing about legends is: sometimes theyâ€™re true.
Welcome to our legendâ€¦The Legend of Sleepy Hollowâ€¦â€

Link :
[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Washington_Irving](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Washington_Irving)

items.title:
Dear People! 
Please make sure you always check if the offer is legit before senâ€¦
items.summary:
Dear People! 
Please make sure you always check if the offer is legit before sending any personal data to anyone!
Scammers are everywhere.

Especially with big events and well-known brands, you should always get an official e-mail address and name of the agency handling the casting that you can then double check to make sure they are legit and handling this particular casting. 

No big events cast Performers via private messages on Facebook. 

I just warned people under one post here and was blocked by the person who wrote it, which proves to me it was a scam.

i know that finding jobs is tough right now, but donâ€™t let evil people take advantage of you ğŸ’œğŸ’œğŸ’œ donâ€™t rush, double check, keep your data private.

Lots of love!

items.summary:
Casting Call! Warrington/Manchester area, late October/early November filming dates.

We are looking for one Female and one Male actor to play the lead roles in our upcoming short film, â€˜Oh, Deathâ€™, a comedy drama exploring themes of choice, family, death and morality. Synopsis below;

After his abrupt and unexpected death, Peter is almost elated to be greeted by an Agent of Death and to discover that there is an afterlife. Peter believes heâ€™s done enough good to earn his ticket Up, but when sarcastic and bored Margo tells him heâ€™s going Down, Peter has only a short time to convince her to change her mind to avoid an eternity of punishment.

The Roles-

Peter- 
Male
Age- 35-45

Personality- Selfish, uncaring, wants to be good but rarely musters up the effort to do so

Requirements for the role- Willing to learn a few Gaelic phrases

Margo- 
Female
Age- 30-40

Personality- Sarcastic, funny, rude, nonchalant yet an imposing figure

Requirements for the role- Willing to learn a few Gaelic phrases

Due to the limited budget of our film, roles are unpaid but we will cover the cost of travel and provide/pay for food and drink. Filming will take place in Warrington/Manchester area, filming dates are;

Saturday 25th October
Friday 7th November
Saturday 8th November

If youâ€™re interested, weâ€™d love to hear from you! 

Send an email to deadhorsestudios2025@gmail.com stating which character youâ€™d like to play and a link to your showreel if you have one! Shortlisted actors will be given more character information and will be asked to record a self tape of one of the scenes before we make our final decision.

You can visit our YouTube or Instagram page, Dead Horse Studios, to check out a little of what weâ€™re about, including our latest short film, â€˜The Blockâ€™ that was entered into the Cannes Film Festival earlier this year.

We canâ€™t wait to hear from you,
Andrew and the rest of the Dead Horse Studios crew.

items.title: Casting "The Quiet Soul," an independent short film exploring themes of isolatioâ€¦
items.summary:
Casting "The Quiet Soul," an independent short film exploring themes of isolation, resilience, and the quiet strength of human connection. The story follows Nathan, a young athlete whose life is suddenly upended when he suffers a stroke, leaving him with locked-in syndrome. Trapped within his own body, Nathan faces the challenge of reconnecting with the world around him, rediscovering his independence, and navigating the emotional distance that has grown between him and those he loves.

"The Quiet Soul" is a story of enduring connection, showing how love and perseverance can bridge the deepest barriers, even when words are no longer possible.

We are looking to audition and cast 10 actors (5 female and 5 male) with short speaking roles for an E-Learning course. This role requires experience with on-camera speaking roles. You will also be required to perform a â€œdirect-camera addressâ€ as if the camera were a character in the scene.

)(The videos are for e-learning, similar to these: [https://takealtus.com/test-prep/](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Ftakealtus.com%2Ftest-prep%2F%3Ffbclid%3DIwAR0poBn0t5g5GbreTULR2-FRPHoxayx2TovypPg13E5tbnMkgmeFObmIYho&h=AT1o4d1iYN1mDpDZ5EU_K67bwrFT7MRUs188GmLDQHOKvCL5uJq1xukO9CQ_xpiVieYLaZtl3IPeWjmkDMoFX5xozIc8Oehe_gqsMyOtWzf9wPss8dXq3p3Xg3DZXJT_vd8g&__tn__=-UK-R&c[0]=AT1f9jLo_7MmoIBsOS_dIQf1LjJZCANyopyGg_UnInqWe2z59TtN7VXpgZmWSRZeIUp40edSb4n3zI4durDUKA7pFUsRTHw-rc3xd8NOtC1mCS3rV0Icwi-a96z3DDPXluUVRvpp8WRHPa5quRrmA4RCP73Yr7TBC8h7t88oxONPbl3mW6A)

with the following assets:Please forward your applications and auditions to [https://docs.google.com/.../1FAIpQLSexwYdewcS.../viewform...](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSexwYdewcScTMfl0wcXOSLiTFeC-7WdaXT-eC6G8v6VDP9D4Q/viewform?usp=sf_link&fbclid=IwAR07f02q-gBK0Lytri2uPlOxVsZvmhU-M7Z7Sjs4tmSRRBf_kmQ0gakqQRg)

A portrait or headshot

Your name

Your age

Your tel & email

A video recording of yourself acting out the sample script (more details below)

Or email it to sondageperspectives@gmail.com

Video Audition

Please choose one of the following scripts below based on the age range and character-type youâ€™d like to audition for, and record yourself reading that characterâ€™s lines.

Script 1 (Male auditions): see page 2

Script 2 (Female auditions): see page 3

Submission Deadline: Wednesday June 8th, 11 AM

SCRIPT 1: Male Audition Script Read

Adam: *Sees Matt coming out of a room* Hey! What did you think about the exam?

Matt: You guys want to know a secret?

Adam: *Confused Look* Secret? Sure?

Matt: Okay but promise me you wonâ€™t tell ANYBODY!

Adam: *exhales* I promise.

Matt: *Whispers slowly* I cheated.

Adam: You what?!? That is not okay!

Matt: Shhh itâ€™s okay, everyone cheats, whatâ€™s the big deal?

Adam: Itâ€™s not fair for people like me who put in the work to study for these exams! Plus, the professor asked us to report any incidence of cheating and its university policy.

Matt: Can you calm down! I might fail the course if the professor finds out that I cheated. Plus, any cheating violation will be on my transcript so future employers might not hire me. I have so much to lose.

Adam: Yeah but...*Gets interrupted by Matt*

Matt: Look, you promised me that you wonâ€™t tell anybody. So, Iâ€™m trusting you. Anyways I'm getting late for my next class, Iâ€™ll talk to you later. *Walks out of frame*

Adam: *Stares into camera with a stressed attitude* This is not okay...We need to do something about this.

SCRIPT 2: Female Audition Script Read

Emily: *Looks at Claire and camera* I canâ€™t wait to get off work.

Claire: Me too! Do you guys have any plans for the weekend?

Emily: Iâ€™m actually going on a date tomorrow!

Claire: What! Whoâ€™s the lucky man?

Emily: *Hesitates* Uhh...Uhh...*Looks at Claire and camera* promise me you both wonâ€™t tell anyone.

Claire: *Confused Look while looking at camera* Okay?... We promise.

Emily: *Gasp* Itâ€™s Dave.

Claire: Dave?!?, our manager?

Emily: Shhh calm down itâ€™s not a big deal.

Claire: Itâ€™s against company policy for co-workers to date. This could end up being really bad for both of you. Just last month, 2 employees got fired for dating each another.

Emily: Well, Dave is the manager, so no one is going to know, and you better stay quiet about it. Remember, you promised me that you wonâ€™t tell anyone!

Claire: *Stares into camera and gasps*

CASTING CALL NOTICE

UNPAID CASTING CALL

WHERE: Yellville, Arkansas & St. Louis, Missouri
COMPENSATION: Housing, Food, Credit, Copy for Reel (Traveling costs can be discussed)

THIS FILM DEALS WITH SEXUAL ASSAULT, VIOLENCE AGAINST WOMEN, UNDERAGE SMOKING AND DRINKING, AND SEXUAL SCENARIOS AND THEMES. IF THIS IS TRIGGERING FOR YOU, PLEASE DO NOT AUDITION. We need actors who are able to portray these characters without harming their mental wellbeing.

Tell Them is a psychological thriller directed by Gray Love Campbell and produced by Magdalene Harper and Griffin Smith. Eight friends - Luke, Jack, Theo, Emmett, Lottie, Noah, Melody, and Stevie - are excited for a weekend getaway to a remote cabin thatâ€™s guaranteed to be filled with drinking, smoking, dumb games, and some messy hook ups. When a game of spin the bottle goes awry, a dark secret about Jack and Stevie is revealed. The night is ruined and all hell breaks loose. Stevie tries to disappear and gain her composure. In her emotional state, she clings to the only person there for her: Theo. Itâ€™s heated. Itâ€™s desperate. Itâ€™s- quickly ended. After a mean joke, Theo snaps and kills Stevie.  When the group downstairs hears the commotion and come across the body, the only thing they can do is to cover up whatâ€™s been doneâ€¦ by blaming someone else.

CHARACTERS NEEDED:
Theo (21) - Male. White. Lean or average build but is deceptively strong. 

Noah (20) - Female. White. Blonde with a commanding presence.

Jack (21) - Male. White. Tall, muscular, and handsome.

Lottie (20) - Female. White. Brunette.

items.title: Zelda and David, a recently separated couple, are locked in a bitter custody batâ€¦
items.summary:
Zelda and David, a recently separated couple, are locked in a bitter custody battle over their daughter, Ava. When they reunite with their new partners under one roof, tensions escalate into a dark, twisted gameâ€”each couple secretly plotting to poison the other in a desperate bid for sole custody. 

Inspired by Impressionism, this film uses light as a metaphor for time to explore the shifting nature of human relationships. As spaces and objects remain unchanged, emotions disintegrateâ€”what once nurtured love now houses its unraveling.

Korean director Won Jang, whose award-winning short film The Stench garnered critical acclaim, is deeply committed to directing this project. As both the writer and the original source of inspiration, he brings a unique personal vision to the story. He believes his intimate connection to the material makes him best suited to authentically convey the characters' emotions in his feature debut.

Key Information

Shooting Dates - 5th-15th October 2025

Shooting Location - We will be filming in a house near Camelford, Cornwall. You will need to be able to drive to location as public transport doesnâ€™t reach it. Alternatively if youâ€™re London based or in the South of England, we can provide accommodation on set.

Rates

The main characters:  Â£100 a day 

Fuel costs will be covered if Cornwall based and the set is catered

How To Apply

Please send your headshot and showreel to the following email: assassinationfilm@gmail.com

Application Deadline: Saturday 13th September

The Roles

Zelda

Required for the full 10 days

Playing Age: early 30s to early 40sï¿½

Gender: Femaleï¿½

Accent: Neutral or regional as required

Zelda is an emotionally vulnerable yet guarded woman, shaped by the pain of a traumatic miscarriage and the breakdown of her marriage. She presents a sharp wit and a defiant streak, often appearing irritable and defensive. Beneath that, however, is a deep well of longing and emotional complexity. Though she's with a new partner, she remains unsettledâ€”yearning for connection and hoping to find it in the possibility of a new, stable family.

Additional Notes:

A background in dance or movement is a plus. Actor must be comfortable portraying psychological nuance, emotional stillness, and layered internal shifts.

Thomas

Required for 6 of the 10 shooting dates (TBD)

Playing Age: 30's

Gender: Male

Accent: Neutral or regional as required

Thomas is a shamelessly self-serving manâ€”charming on the surface, but manipulative and cunning underneath. He uses his natural charisma to influence others and mask his true motives, though not as skillfully as he believes. His overconfidence often reveals the cracks in his carefully constructed facade, making his deceit more obvious than he intends.

CASTING CALL 
St. James's Place x Sky Arts Idents

Are you an artist with a mentor or supporter you want to celebrate?

Raw Research Casting is looking for artists and makers from any artistic discipline (including visual arts, theatre, music, dance, design, crafts, and more) who would like to celebrate a mentor or supporter who made a real difference in their creative journey.

Whether itâ€™s a teacher, friend, partner, parent, grandparent, sibling, or colleague - if someone gave you a pivotal piece of advice or support that helped shape your creative path, we want to hear from you.

Each short film (ident) will feature interviews with both the artist and their mentor / supporter, along with footage of the artistâ€™s creative work or process. Crucially, will need the artists to supply photos or video clips that show their career development too.

Filming will take place in London for one day during the week of 21st July 2025.

Both the artist and their mentor/supporter will be paid for their time.

To apply or find out more, email casting@rawresearch.co.uk with the subject line â€œARTIST CASTINGâ€.
